DataElement.preferredName: Emission Scan Sweep Length Duration Minute Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The length or duration of the linear extent of an arc over a specified body part or area of emitted signal or discharge with a sensing device measured in minutes.  [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The linear extent of an arc over a specified body part or area of emitted signal or discharge with a sensing device.  [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A substance that is emitted or released.:Pictures of structures inside the body. Scans often used in diagnosing, staging, and monitoring disease include liver scans, bone scans, and computed tomography (CT) or computerized axial tomography (CAT) scans and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scans. In liver scanning and bone scanning, radioactive substances that are injected into the bloodstream collect in these organs. A scanner that detects the radiation is used to create pictures. In CT scanning, an x-ray machine linked to a computer is used to produce detailed pictures of organs inside the body. MRI scans use a large magnet connected to a computer to create pictures of areas inside the body.

Concepts.definition: A substance that is emitted or released.
The data or image obtained by gathering information with a sensing device.

Property.preferredDefinition: A movement in an arc over a specified body part or area.:Length; the linear extent in space from one end to the other.

Concepts.definition: A movement in an arc over a specified body part or area.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/5/08 - released for UofWASH FES CRF.  3/3/08 - DEC created for U of  WASH FES, FMISO studies

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Length or duration of an event or activity measured in minutes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A unit measure of time equal to 60 seconds.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
